content.html: Good point! If we choose to not wrap the library we‚Äôre in global change territory. Choosing a wrapper might make initial adoption a bit slower (costly) but simplify migration work.
content.text: Good point! If we choose to not wrap the library we‚Äôre in global change territory. Choosing a wrapper might make initial adoption a bit slower (costly) but simplify migration work.

content.html: Great questions. I guess it's a tradeoff between convenience and maintainability. Wrapping up the library helps you reduce the cost of upgrading the library but as the library add more features and capabilities it requires to update your wrapper before adopting them.
content.text: Great questions. I guess it's a tradeoff between convenience and maintainability. Wrapping up the library helps you reduce the cost of upgrading the library but as the library add more features and capabilities it requires to update your wrapper before adopting them.

My take: this is a lean method for testing ideas, but not the end game which would have these links.

For what it‚Äôs worth, 90% of what‚Äôs in ship 30, if not 99% are all lessons and frameworks I created for myself over the past 10 years writing. I created the curriculum from my own hard lessons learned, not from someone else‚Äôs material.

content.html:
This test verifies that you accept a Webmention request that contains a valid source and target URL. To pass this test, your Webmention endpoint must return either HTTP 200, 201 or 202 along with the appropriate headers.

If your endpoint returns HTTP 201, then it MUST also return a Location header. If it returns HTTP 200 or 202, then it MUST NOT include a Location header.
content.text:
This test verifies that you accept a Webmention request that contains a valid source and target URL. To pass this test, your Webmention endpoint must return either HTTP 200, 201 or 202 along with the appropriate headers.
        If your endpoint returns HTTP 201, then it MUST also return a Location header. If it returns HTTP 200 or 202, then it MUST NOT include a Location header.
